jobs_results.title: iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
Do you want to join us on an exceptional growth journey with massive social impact? Are you a skilled and curious iOS Developer who cares about your craft and user impact? And does working with passionate tech colleagues on one of the Nordic's most purpose-strong consumer apps excite you? Then we have just the job for you!

Tiimo is a daily planner and learning platform designed by and for neurodivergent individuals (people with ADHD, Autism, dyslexia, OCD). 20% of the global population (1.6 billion people) is estimated to be neurodivergent and often struggle living meaningful lives. 30-40% of neurodivergent individuals are unemployed, 80% of adults with ADHD will suffer from depression or anxiety and two out of three autistic adults will have considered suicide.Tiimois changing that!

We are based in Copenhagen, Denmark. Our culture thrives on empathy, ambition and making a real difference.Tiimohas more than 500,000 users worldwide and +50K app downloads per month. During 2024, Tiimo was nominated as a finalist for an Apple Design Award in the Inclusion category, which recognizes apps that use technology to promote inclusion across races, genders, disabilities, and more.

As our iOS Developer, you need to be an excellent and hands-on developer and a team player. You will be developing our apps for the Apple ecosystem, currently available on iOS, iPadOS and watchOS. Together the rest of our developers and designer, you will be building new fantastic product features. We are building everything in-house, and you will be a part of a great, friendly and ambitious 10-person strong and CPH-based Tech and Product team.

In this role, you will...
• Develop and maintain our iOS, iPadOS, and watchOS apps, the first of which we have almost completely rewritten in SwiftUI
• Collaborate with design and the product team to create user-friendly interfaces
• Optimize application performance
• Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices

You will be a great fit if...
• You are an experienced iOS Developer who knows the craft of building beautiful and native user-friendly interfaces for Apple platforms, such as iOS, iPadOS and watchOS.
• You're committed to write clean, scalable and maintainable code.
• You're good at breaking down designs into clear development tasks.
• You are purpose passionate.At Tiimo we are passionate about making a difference for an underserved neurodiverse community and hope that you share this passion with us.
• You are a detail-oriented problem-solver with good communication skills. We need you to own your own domain and assist in refining new features for our products and we believe that building great software requires great communication and compassion.
• You thrive in an international and inclusive environment.We are a team from many different nationalities. English is our working language.
• You have security and stability at the front of your mind.
• Love using modern work tools.Linear for issue tracking, Github as source control, Xcode Cloud for CI/CD, RevenueCat for subscription management, Firebase for error reporting, Mixpanel/Metabase for analytics, Slack for internal communication, Figma for design, and Notion as a knowledge base.
• Additional "nice to have" experience includes:
• Experience with CI/CD Pipelines
• Experience with SwiftUI
• Experience with unit/integration tests
• Experience from similar sized startup/scaleup.

Other very important benefits and things to take note of
• Flexibility! We're all wired differently and our needs are not all the same
• As much responsibility as you want and help from an experienced team who loves working together
• Hands on experience designing for an app that reaches thousands of wonderful users around the world and has a major impact on people's wellbeing
• Diversity, equality and inclusion are important to us. Meanwhile, you must have the right to work within the EU, sadly we will not be able to support applicants in gaining a work permit.

How to apply
Simply follow the one-click application process and share your Linkedin profile with us. We prefer to keep things uncomplicated for now and get to know the real you in the face2face part of the interview process. The deadline to apply is midnight on December 15th 2024. We are continuously reviewing applications, so do hit the apply button now if you don't want to miss out on this opportunity!

We will get in touch with successful applicants for the next round, which will involve a task, followed by a short interview. If you have any questions about the job, you are welcome to contact us.

Your impact in this role won't just be limited to building our product, but you will be able to have a direct effect on the wellbeing of millions across the globe.

All the best, Team Tiimo

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
Do you want to join us on an exceptional growth journey with massive social impact? Are you a skilled and curious iOS Developer who cares about your craft and user impact? And does working with passionate tech colleagues on one of the Nordic's most purpose-strong consumer apps excite you? Then we have just the job for you!

Tiimo is a daily planner and learning platform designed by and for neurodivergent individuals (people with ADHD, Autism, dyslexia, OCD). 20% of the global population (1.6 billion people) is estimated to be neurodivergent and often struggle living meaningful lives. 30-40% of neurodivergent individuals are unemployed, 80% of adults with ADHD will suffer from depression or anxiety and two out of three autistic adults will have considered suicide. Tiimo is changing that!

We are based in Copenhagen, Denmark. Our culture thrives on empathy, ambition and making a real difference. Tiimo has more than 500,000 users worldwide and +50K app downloads per month. During 2024, Tiimo was nominated as a finalist for an Apple Design Award in the Inclusion category, which recognizes apps that use technology to promote inclusion across races, genders, disabilities, and more.

As our iOS Developer, you need to be an excellent and hands-on developer and a team player. You will be developing our apps for the Apple ecosystem, currently available on iOS, iPadOS and watchOS. Together the rest of our developers and designer, you will be building new fantastic product features. We are building everything in-house, and you will be a part of a great, friendly and ambitious 10-person strong and CPH-based Tech and Product team.

In this role, you will…
• Develop and maintain our iOS, iPadOS, and watchOS apps, the first of which we have almost completely rewritten in SwiftUI
• Collaborate with design and the product team to create user-friendly interfaces
• Optimize application performance
• Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices

You will be a great fit if...
• You are an experienced iOS Developer who knows the craft of building beautiful and native user-friendly interfaces for Apple platforms, such as iOS, iPadOS and watchOS.
• You’re committed to write clean, scalable and maintainable code.
• You’re good at breaking down designs into clear development tasks.
• You are purpose passionate. At Tiimo we are passionate about making a difference for an underserved neurodiverse community and hope that you share this passion with us.
• You are a detail-oriented problem-solver with good communication skills. We need you to own your own domain and assist in refining new features for our products and we believe that building great software requires great communication and compassion.
• You thrive in an international and inclusive environment. We are a team from many different nationalities. English is our working language.
• You have security and stability at the front of your mind.
• Love using modern work tools. Linear for issue tracking, Github as source control, Xcode Cloud for CI/CD, RevenueCat for subscription management, Firebase for error reporting, Mixpanel/Metabase for analytics, Slack for internal communication, Figma for design, and Notion as a knowledge base.
• Additional “nice to have” experience includes:
• Experience with CI/CD Pipelines
• Experience with SwiftUI
• Experience with unit/integration tests
• Experience from similar sized startup/scaleup.

Other very important benefits and things to take note of
• Flexibility! We’re all wired differently and our needs are not all the same
• As much responsibility as you want and help from an experienced team who loves working together 💪🏽
• Hands on experience designing for an app that reaches thousands of wonderful users around the world and has a major impact on people’s wellbeing 🧡
• Diversity, equality and inclusion are important to us. Meanwhile, you must have the right to work within the EU, sadly we will not be able to support applicants in gaining a work permit.

How To Apply

Simply follow the one-click application process and share your Linkedin profile with us. We prefer to keep things uncomplicated for now and get to know the real you in the face2face part of the interview process. The deadline to apply is midnight on December 15th 2024. We are continuously reviewing applications, so do hit the apply button now if you don’t want to miss out on this opportunity!

We will get in touch with successful applicants for the next round, which will involve a task, followed by a short interview. If you have any questions about the job, you are welcome to contact us.

Your impact in this role won’t just be limited to building our product, but you will be able to have a direct effect on the wellbeing of millions across the globe.

All the best, Team Tiimo

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
Want to develop next-level mobile applications for our world-leading golf products together with a skilled team of developers?

Looking to use your iOS development skills and be part of building a brand new app from the ground up in a fast-paced and creative environment? If this sounds like an exciting challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

We are looking for a senior iOS developer to be part of the development of a brand new Golf app together with a team of senior iOS and Android developers. We have big ambitions for this new app and will be looking to add several multi-functional teams over the coming year as part of this scale-up so there will be lots of opportunities to have an impact and grow.

You will be working closely with developers working on the Trackman Golf app which is the gateway into the Trackman ecosystem and allows users to connect with others, find a Trackman golf simulator or driving range, enhance their golf practice through insightful data, and have fun with games by themselves or with others.

In the Trackman Mobile Golf Department we are more than 20 app developers building high-quality apps for our golf products. We build for iOS and Android and for phones and tablet. We work in several technologies, but with a shared passion for creating quality apps and user experiences.

You will join a team of skilled senior developers who love what they do and in a role where you will have an opportunity to have a big impact both on what is being built and how it is built. We value having our developers being part of the refinement early and you will be deeply involved in finding great solutions from a technical as well as a user perspective together with our product owners and UI/UX designers.

We have a flat hierarchy and believe in building and shaping the product together, pushing ourselves to always improve, and having fun whilst doing it!

What we're looking for

We look for an experienced candidate who is passionate about Android development and can be an active part of the open and creative atmosphere in the team and can take a lead on refining and implementing great features for our customers.

You likely have:
• Demonstrated skills as an iOS developer, ideally with significant Swift and SwiftUI experience in a production environment.
• More than 3 years experience, and have worked on building and maintaining an app over a longer period of time. We have millions of users using our apps and products, so experience with software at this scale is a plus.
• Experience with Agile Development, Scrum, Unit Testing, Design Patterns, CI/CD and Continuous Integration is a big asset.
• Kotlin Multi-platform is something we are experimenting with, so experience with this is a bonus.
• The ability to work effectively within a team, communicating, and sharing knowledge along the way.

We are scaling up significantly so experience leading a team or having the ambition to do so is a plus.
Some understanding of Android development can also come in handy as you will be refining on features alongside developers working on the Android version of the app you will work on.
You work independently and have a willingness to share knowledge and continually develop your skill set. You probably have an educational background within computer science (or equivalent). If you play golf, that is a bonus, but not a requirement.

The Office

We offer a great office environment and facilities in our brand-new purpose-built Trackman Innovation Center, located at DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We take great pride in the building we designed and built! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness center, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, and Tokyo. We employ over 700 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion!

For additional information about the position, please contact Head of Mobile Golf, Aske Robenhagen at aro@trackman.com. Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application as soon as possible.

jobs_results.title: iOS Mobile Developer
jobs_results.description:
At Trifork we're looking for a

iOS Mobile Developer to join our team.

Full-time · Copenhagen, Denmark

You are passionated about mobile development and wants to unfold your multitude skills within native mobile development?
Come and join Trifork Smart Enterprise in Copenhagen!

About us

Trifork Smart Enterprise loves people who love what they do. If you are driven by technology, you will feel right at home.

We are a team of 50 dedicated people located in Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Barcelona that develops and delivers exciting projects in the intersection of mobility, web and ERP.

Our ambition is to create the best synergy between the business, IT, and the end-users. Trifork Smart Enterprise is a preferred Apple and SAP partner with an ever-burning passion for innovating, building, and running digital solutions that create value for businesses as well as end-users.

Our daily work is characterized by an open and honest atmosphere and we put emphasis on creating a challenging, yet fun working environment with sparring and knowledge sharing. We work in agile and cross-functional teams with focus on close collaborations with customers.

About you

We are looking for a iOS Mobile Developer with a passion for delivering unique solutions with great design that makes a difference for the customer.

Do you have a broad technological foundation in computer science and system development? And do you have strong skills within several (but not necessarily all) of the following:
• At least 4 years of experience in development Swift.
• Development and maintenance of native mobile applications.
• Experience with SwiftUi, MVVM-C, Delegation, Combine, Dependency Injection and Unit tests
• Experience with animation e.g. Lottie and best in class UI designs.
• Modern tooling and platforms such as: Custom REST API's, pipelines, Git/GitHub Actions and Jira.
• Experience with API's, services and cloud solutions as backend for mobile solutions

The development within mobile is progressing extremely fast and the expectations of customers and users follows. Therefore, we use Native iOS in our solutions and we imagine that you are the type of person who can hardly wait to acquire knowledge of new technology, methodology, and tools. Since we have local clients, it is important to be able to communicate professionally in Danish and English.

Your tasks and days are amongst others:
• Working onsite 2-3 days a week at the customer site close to Copenhagen together with a team of developers.
• Development and maintenance of applications within gaming industry.
• Participation in end-to-end development processes including code reviews.
• Close collaborations with colleagues in different job functions.
• Working with stakeholders across the business (such as Product owners, Business Analysts, Product Specialists, Customer Support etc.)
• Support and quality assurance of solutions.
• Track the app health with the help of logging/analytics/observability

Our promise to you

You will become part of a strong and passionate team where every team member is a specialist within their field and together you provide complete solutions to our customers.

We prioritize close collaborations very highly, both across teams and internally in the team.

You will have the possibility to develop mobile solutions that makes a difference to our end-users. You will become part of dynamic environment in a growing company that is a tribe of passionate colleagues and has a strong sense of community.

Furthermore, we promise you:
• A dynamic environment and opportunities for skill development.
• Access to unlimited GOTO Conferences content that will allow you to understand software practices from new angles.
• A happy corporate culture with passionate colleagues and strong family feeling.
• An informal workplace, humor, and social events.
• Competitive salary with pension scheme, health insurance, and flexible working hours.

Apply for the job

Our office in Copenhagen is located at Gdanskgade 2, 2150 Nordhavn, Copenehagen.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact our Head of Development Michael Svith Thøgersen: +45 2160 7133.

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Software Engineer
jobs_results.description: Senior iOS Software Engineer role at Too Good To Go, focusing on empowering developers and enhancing iOS development experience.

jobs_results.title: iOS developer
jobs_results.description:
Are you excited about creating an app that streamlines everyday work for more than 60.000 daily users? Then you have the opportunity to join our small app team with big ambitions!

We offer
• A position where you can grow, learn and have an impact in your work
• A helpful, social and diverse workplace with a flat hierarchy and open communication
• A good and healthy work/life balance
• 42 friendly, competent and driven colleagues
• A centrally located office in the heart of Copenhagen (Soon moving to Visma House in Carlsbergbyen)

… And much more!

In Intempus we are on a mission to simplify and optimize time tracking with innovation, AI and user-friendly design. With 12 years of experience, our system serves +60.000 users on a daily basis.

Our development team includes 20+ passionate developers across various teams. As an iOS developer, you will collaborate with three other app developers, each bringing unique skills and experience, to improve and perfect our time tracking app.

Your primary tasks will be to
• Work closely with our product owner and UX team to help design and translate mockups into live screens.
• Collaborate with the app team to provide ongoing maintenance for the app, including bug fixes, feature updates, and compatibility updates with new iOS versions.
• Work closely with our backend team to Integrate with APIs, and databases to fetch and store data needed for the application.
• Help with continuous deployment and contribute to publishing the app on the App Store, and manage app updates.

We are looking for an iOS developer with
• A bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
• 3-5 years of experience with Native iOS App development.
• Good grasp of Objective-C/Swift is a must
• Experience with Storyboard based iOS application
• Familiar with SwiftUI
• Good grasp of OOP RESTful APIs and Core Data

“Intempus is my first workplace as a software engineer and it has been a blast! We have an amazing international team where everyone brings something unique to the table. There is definite awareness that we are working together to give the best product experience to our customers. And most of all, it is so rewarding to see how not only the product is getting better, but we as a team and individuals are growing too.”

– Inese Ieraga, Backend Software Engineer

Wanna join us?

Apply now if you can see yourself becoming part of our team and time-saving mission.

We are looking for a new colleague to join us from 1st of November 2024, however, we are flexible for the right candidate!

The job is on-site at our office in Copenhagen. If you live outside of Denmark, we can help with visa sponsorship.

We will have interviews on an on-going basis so do not hesistate to send us your application as soon as possible.

We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
Headquarters: Copenhagen, Denmark
URL: https://shape.dk
Shape is an award-winning native app development studio. We are known for building high-quality mobile apps that tackle real problems and push businesses forward.

At Shape, you will work with talented designers and developers to build awesome digital products. You will put your existing skills to good use, and learn new ones by working together with other skilled people.

We’re looking for a Senior iOS Developer to join a new remote-first team of developers from all over the world.

The opportunity

In this role, you will join a new remote-first team of developers distributed across the world. You will work closely with your peers to build world class products - all the way from proposal to release. You will architect high-impact solutions using the newest technologies and execute them against a set of success-criteria. You will also:
• Step up to resolve product issues - large and small.
• Tackle everything from huge new features to important bug fixes, from start to finish.
• Take ownership of major features and lead their maintenance and improvements over time.
• Collaborate with peers remotely during brainstorms, technical design discussions, design reviews and code reviews.

What you will bring to Shape
• Solid experience with developing native iOS apps using Swift and the iOS SDK.
• Passion for writing pragmatic, performant and testable code.
• Skills to lead and collaborate on high-impact and complex projects from proposal through release.
• Ability to work independently and be self-driven in all aspects of your work.
• Excellent communication skills. We’re a distributed team, so frequent and clear communication is a must.

Why join Shape?

History of success. For over a decade, we have brought impactful digital products to life and while we are not in it for the accolades, it is nice to be recognised for what you do. With over 50 national and international awards and honors under our belts, it shows we are doing something right in our quest to deliver results for those we work with.

Be on the front line of progress and innovation. We are passionate about building great products using the latest technology while creating reusable components, empowering teams to ship apps faster and with better user experience.

International team. Shape is very international and so far includes people from over 30 different countries. Our company language is English.

Take charge of your schedule. You will join a remote-first team working asynchronously giving you the freedom and flexibility to organize your own work schedules.

Work/life balance. From day one, we have been committed to making a place where people can do the best work in a meaningful way. This means working reasonable hours, spending each day in a welcoming environment, and taking time off when you need it. We believe in doing everything we can to help our people live healthy and full lives while doing work that makes a tangible difference.

What we have to offer you
• A team of exceptional developers
• 6 weeks vacation
• A 37.5 hour work week
• Work from anywhere in the world
• Take charge of your own schedule
• The opportunity to attend or present at global conferences and meetups
• Yearly company offsite with travel expenses paid
• The possibility to visit our office in Copenhagen

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs_results.description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 107 million registered users and 242,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 388+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1049.000 tonnes of CO2e!

The Role

We are looking for a Senior iOS Software Engineer to join our Tech Foundation team, focused on empowering developers across product teams to deliver high-quality solutions efficiently.

Too Good To Go is expanding, bringing in more developers and rapidly growing our codebase.

As part of the Foundation team, your focus will be on enabling seamless collaboration across this shared codebase to ensure product teams’ ability to deliver high-quality features. By enhancing code quality, testability, development processes, and monitoring, we empower our developers to work together efficiently and effectively.

As a Team Member on the Foundation team, you’ll collaborate with other Engineers to achieve specific outcomes, with the freedom and responsibility to determine the best approach.

Your mission will be to help refine, design, implement, deliver, and maintain a range of internal services, libraries, frameworks, and tools, all aimed at enhancing the iOS developer experience.

As a Senior Engineer, you will actively support your engineering lead in delivering a high-quality, maintainable, and top-class product. You’ll also serve as a role model for less experienced team members, demonstrating ownership of challenges and applying your expertise to identify effective solutions.

At our company, we prioritise quality over strict deadlines, and we want to take pride in our work.

The Tech Stack

Our tech stack includes an iOS app built with Swift and SwiftUI, following the MVVM design pattern.

Your Mission
• Deliver top-quality products, focusing on maintainability and scalability.
• Take on tasks beyond your current role, with support from your team, to expand your skills and knowledge.
• Engage in mentoring and coaching, and foster a culture of regular, constructive feedback with your peers.
• Inspire your team by providing guidance and demonstrating actions that contribute to building the best long-term product.
• Take ownership of challenges as they arise, considering the bigger picture — even if it falls outside your usual responsibilities.
• Think big: push your limits and consider innovative ways to enhance scalability, by:
• Simplifying complex tasks into manageable pieces.
• Sharing your expertise.
• Distributing work effectively.
• Automating repetitive processes.
• Honor your commitments and maintain accountability.
• Actively participate in your team’s agile processes, with a commitment to continuous improvement.

The Ideal Candidate:
• Is proficient in developing native iOS applications using Xcode and Swift.
• Approaches challenges with a solutions-oriented mindset.
• Has a proactive attitude and works well within a team environment.
• Has experience building scalable solutions.
• Takes pride in writing clean, quality code.
• Is passionate about writing tests and creating testable code.
• Stays up-to-date with the latest technologies.
• Seeks to improve processes and implement best practices.
• Has experience with CI systems (such as GitHub Actions and fastlane).
• Holds a relevant degree in software engineering.

Our values
• We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
• We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
• We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
• We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
• We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

What We Have To Offer
• An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
• To be an integral member of our defined product teams. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the product scope and development; Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
• Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime. On-call duty is not part of the job, but can be additionally agreed upon should you and your manager both wish it. We believe that happy environments create happy employees.
• We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
• To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
• An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
• We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
• We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
• We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.

How to apply
• We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
• Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
• Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref: #LI-TC1

#LI-Hybrid

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer
jobs_results.description: EPICO NextGen er bindeleddet mellem den næste generation af IT-Talenter og det næste job i IT-branchen. Vi hjælper dig med det rette job via vores netværk, som vi har skabt til virksomhederne. Vi har skabt en bred vifte af jobmuligheder inden for både små, mellemstore og store virksomheder, der generelt er langt fremme på den tekniske front.

jobs_results.title: Experienced Flutter Developer - Fully Remote
jobs_results.description:
ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing rapid growth. Becoming the best at something isn’t easy. It takes skill, hard work, and an unmatched level of ambition and determination. Our team is international, experienced and most of all, hardworking. In just a few years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our teams located all over the globe.

From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VC’s Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.

The position:

As we take our business to the next level, ViaBill is looking to hire a motivated Flutter Developer to expand our tech, processes, and client applications. You will be driving the main development efforts on our mobile payments application made with Flutter and build production-ready plugins to Android and iOS.

We are looking for a developer that should have solid experience in:
• Implementing sophisticated and highly scalable apps using Flutter
• Implementing applications for the iOS & Android platform with at least two years of experience
• Familiarity with RESTful APIs
• Familiarity with the GIT
• Understanding of the Agile development life-cycle
• Experience with CI/CD for mobile applications
• Focus on QA by using unit and integration tests
• B.Sc/M.Sc or equivalent experience in computer science or a related field
• You speak and write English fluently

You are:
• Used to working in a fully remote setup
• Ultra-focused on the end user
• Motivated in a fast-paced, changing environment
• Able to keep calm, focused, and prioritize under pressure
• Independent and take initiative

About our team:

We are a team of highly motivated developers who work remotely from our own offices. We collaborate much like open-source projects with core maintainers for our services. Each developer has a lot of freedom working in a flat hierarchy in a very streamlined process where the domain experts are easily available on Slack or via Meet. We work with a very rapid release schedule, often releasing multiple times per day. This gives us a quick and motivating feedback loop. This also makes it very easy for a developer to see their effect on business! This allows us to experiment and adopt new trends/frameworks quickly.

Meet our Developers!

Please read more about our Privacy Policy https://viabill.dk/gdpr/
